children.content: Whe'r is it, that place, th' foul thing?
Who knows where it went, pillars of stone;
Here lies the ballad of the Empty Castle;
A foolish friend one day happened upon a castle
Not a whole castle, but rather half
The thief grabbed his pestle and scalpel
Attempting to scale the walls, hollow walls, wrought of straw

A pointless defence,        Then the knights came, in plate-mail        But the letters were easy to rip, ceramics went CRASH        The order of knights, now messily un-ordered on the floor        Shattered by someone, in search of a thing        Then bonded out on the great stair case        Or it would be if the total
